title: Communications Services Down as Huawei Tensions Rise — Communications Services Roundup
text:
Communications services companies fell amid fears that rising trade tensions would slow 5G network building worldwide.

Chinese telecom-equipment and smartphone maker Huawei Technologies on Tuesday accused the U.S. of launching cyber attacks against its networks and instructing law enforcement to "menace" its employees.

AT&T promoted longtime executive John Stankey to a newly created No. 2 role, setting up the WarnerMedia boss as the likely successor to Chief Executive Randall Stephenson. Mr. Stankey's ascent came shortly after another Stephenson lieutenant, John Donovan, who led the company's telecom operations, said he was stepping down.

T-Mobile US fell after Illinois' attorney general joined a group of officials from 16 other states suing to block the company's merger with rival Sprint.
